System Configuration

Files

file  pmlib_sysconfig.h
 This file declares the interface for the system configuration for switching on or switching off modules or putting them in HW controlled Auto Clock Gated mode.
 
file  pmlib_sysconfig_pmmc.h
 This file declares the interface for the system configuration for switching on or switching off modules or putting them in HW controlled Auto Clock Gated mode via the PMMC.

  PMLIB_SYS_CONFIG_MAX = PMLIB_SYS_CONFIG_ALWAYS_ENABLED, PMLIB_SYS_CONFIG_COUNT = PMLIB_SYS_CONFIG_MAX + 1U, PMLIB_SYS_CONFIG_INVALID = 0x7FFFFFFF

Detailed Description

System Configuration APIs are used to put the module to a desired power state as specified by the power spread sheet. It abstracts the programming of PRCM registers to enable/disable or auto clock gate a given module. Many modules can be programmed in one go by providing the list of modules and their desired power state.

The system configuration does not take care of dependencies between modules and it is the userâ€™s responsibility to maintain the right dependency order to switch off a given module vs another.

System Configuration APIs are used to put the module to a desired power state. It abstracts the programming of PMMC to enable/disable or auto clock gate a given module. Many modules can be programmed in one go by providing the list of modules and their desired power state.

The system configuration does not take care of dependencies between modules and it is the user's responsibility to maintain the right dependency order to switch off a given module vs another.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum pmlibSysConfigPowerState

Enumeration for programming the desired power mode for the module.

Enumerator
PMLIB_SYS_CONFIG_MIN 

Minimum system configuration mode for the module

PMLIB_SYS_CONFIG_DISABLED 

Module is disabled/ switched off in this mode

PMLIB_SYS_CONFIG_AUTO_CG 

Module is auto clock gated in this mode.

PMLIB_SYS_CONFIG_ALWAYS_ENABLED 

Module is always enabled in this mode

PMLIB_SYS_CONFIG_MAX 

Maximum system configuration mode for the module

PMLIB_SYS_CONFIG_COUNT 

Count of the system configuration modes for the module

PMLIB_SYS_CONFIG_INVALID 

Invalid system configuration

Function Documentation

pmErrCode_t PMLIBSysConfigGetPowerState ( pmhalPrcmModuleId_t  moduleId,
pmlibSysConfigPowerState_t *  currState,
pmlibSysConfigDetailedState_t *  detailedState 
)

This API is used to get the power state for a given module.

Parameters
moduleIdModule ID of the module one is interested in. Refer pmhalPrcmModuleId_t for details.
currStateReturns the final state of the module. Refer pmlibSysConfigPowerState_t for details.
detailedStateThis is an optional parameter which can be used to return the detailed state of the module broken down into module state, clock state and power state. If one is not interested in knowing the detailed state one can put NULL for this parameter.
Returns
status Returns the status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS If the status is obtained correctly.
  • PM_BADARGS If currState pointer is NULL.
pmErrCode_t PMLIBSysConfigPmmcGetPowerState ( pmhalPmmcModuleId_t  moduleId,
uint32_t *  currState,
pmlibSysConfigPmmcDetailedState_t *  detailedState 
)

This API is used to get the power state for a given module.

Parameters
moduleIdModule ID of the module one is interested in. Refer pmhalPrcmModuleId_t for details.
currStateReturns the final state of the module. Refer pmlibSysConfigPowerState_t for details.
detailedStateThis is an optional parameter which can be used to return the detailed state of the module broken down into module state, clock state and power state. If one is not interested in knowing the detailed state one can put NULL for this parameter.
Returns
status Returns the status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS If the status is obtained correctly.
  • PM_BADARGS If currState pointer is NULL.
pmErrCode_t PMLIBSysConfigPmmcPowerStateParams_init ( pmlibSysConfigPmmcPowerStateParams_t *  inputTable,
uint32_t  numConfig 
)

This API initializes the table for the system config.

Parameters
inputTableInput table to be initialized
numConfigNumber of entries in the system configuration table.
Returns
status Returns the status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS If the initialization is complete.
  • PM_BADARGS If the input parameters are not correct.
pmErrCode_t PMLIBSysConfigPmmcSetPowerState ( const pmlibSysConfigPmmcPowerStateParams_t *  inputTable,
uint32_t  numConfig,
uint32_t  timeout,
pmlibSysConfigPmmcErrReturn_t *  resultReturn 
)

This API configures the given module to the desired power state.

Parameters
inputTableTable of modules and their desired power and clock state.
numConfigNumber of entries in the system configuration table.
timeoutDesired time out for which one should wait for each of the modules to reach its desired power state.
  • PM_TIMEOUT_NOWAIT - The API does not wait.
  • PM_TIMEOUT_INFINITE - The API waits infinitely.
  • Any other value - The API waits to any one of the events to happen first :
    • (1) Success of operation
    • (2) The timeout is reached.
resultReturnTable which returns success or error codes got while programming the power state. Useful for debug One must allocate the same number of entries as the input table to ensure the API has sufficient space to return the error or pass codes. The structure returns in the format [module, return code (success/fail code)] for all the modules given in a one to one mapping.
Returns
status Returns the status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS If the desired power state was met.
  • PM_FAIL If the desired power state was not met. One must check the resultReturn to check the cause for failure.
pmErrCode_t PMLIBSysConfigPowerStateParams_init ( pmlibSysConfigPowerStateParams_t *  inputTable,
uint32_t  numConfig 
)

This API initializes the table for the system config.

Parameters
inputTableInput table to be initialized
numConfigNumber of entries in the system configuration table.
Returns
status Returns the status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS If the initialization is complete.
  • PM_BADARGS If the input parameters are not correct.

uint32_t  numConfig,
uint32_t  timeout,
pmlibSysConfigErrReturn_t *  resultReturn 
)

This API configures the given module to the desired power state.

Parameters
inputTableTable of modules and their desired power and clock state.
numConfigNumber of entries in the system configuration table.
timeoutDesired time out for which one should wait for each of the modules to reach its desired power state.
  • PM_TIMEOUT_NOWAIT - The API does not wait.
  • PM_TIMEOUT_INFINITE - The API waits infinitely.
  • Any other value - The API waits to any one of the events to happen first :
    • (1) Success of operation
    • (2) The timeout is reached.
resultReturnTable which returns success or error codes got while programming the power state. Useful for debug One must allocate the same number of entries as the input table to ensure the API has sufficient space to return the error or pass codes. The structure returns in the format [module, return code (success/fail code)] for all the modules given in a one to one mapping.
Returns
status Returns the status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS If the desired power state was met.
  • PM_FAIL If the desired power state was not met. One must check the resultReturn to check the cause for failure.
